channel.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
channel.description:
[center] [img]http://i39.tinypic.com/2q1t7pg.png[/img] [size=18pt][b]Jolt C# RuneScape Emulator by TheAJ and MangiS[/b] [i]http://joltdev.com/[/i][/size][/center]
Hello, Me and MangiS have decided it is now time that we release Jolt v2 to the public. Please use this with respect to the developers of Jolt.
NO LONGER NEEDS MYSQL INSTALLATION! (Comes with MySQL and HTTP server built in!)
Download includes Jolt game files (including source), MySQL server and Apache HTTP server.
Instructions on how to download are in the download.
Download: http://jolte.codeplex.com/releases/view/88914
666 Cache Download: http://www.mirrorcreator.com/files/A672SC0F/cache-666.zip_links
Enjoy everyone! From TheAJ and MangiS
How to develop using Jolt: Download Visual Studio 2010 and start Jolt.sln in /Source/ folder
For a list of all updates go to the development thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,522138.0.html
Pics: http://img59.imageshack.us/img59/6209/jolt1.png http://img502.imageshack.us/img502/7536/uptime.png http://img267.imageshack.us/img267/6324/pricechecker.png http://img252.imageshack.us/img252/5301/trading.png http://img849.imageshack.us/img849/5994/trade2u.png http://img94.imageshack.us/img94/1503/systemupdate1.png http://img140.imageshack.us/img140/6306/systemupdate2.png http://i40.tinypic.com/i6ec1e.png
Support Jolt Development: [img]http://i39.tinypic.com/2q1t7pg.png[/img]

item.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
item.dc:creator: @Nembius Nembius
item.description:
@Nembius wrote:

I have tried getting this to work with this current cache - https://www.dropbox.com/s/ekewr3mg1kda9hn/Cache.rar

However, I keep getting this error - https://gyazo.com/52e92c0d625f73e8af3918cfcb5efa78

Could not find file main_file_cache.idx00

I don’t think this current cache I found has all the required files, does anybody here have the complete cache of 666?

Read full topic

item.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
item.dc:creator: @TheAJ TheAJ
item.description:
@TheAJ wrote:

cdoggy:

I like how it’s ported to C# and people are wanting it to work in Linux. C# is just windows “response” to Java. Silly geese. It would be easier to host a normal client and integrate MySQL than it would be to install all the packages for Linux to run C#. C# is a joke anyways.

This server is not a “port”. It was written from scratch.

Regarding your subjective attitude about C#, it’s not a joke

Read full topic

item.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
item.dc:creator: @TheAJ TheAJ
item.description:
@TheAJ wrote:

AtomicInt_:

I loved this when you were developing it, are you going to continue this by chance?

Probably not. Unless I see a really big demand for it, I probably won’t do any more further development. The server is fully functional, and all the core components are finished. The only stuff missing is content, such as skills, events, etc… We have included very basic content, as an example of how to utilize our scripting system, which includes fishing, woodcutting, firemaking, and mining. Using those as examples, you could easily build a new skill.

One thing I regret not doing is making very detailed comments with examples, which could help speed up the development process for the emulator. If I had properly put in time and effort into making documents, I’m sure there would be alot more support for this project. It’s very massive and hard to develop for in the beginning, but once you figure out how things work, you’ll enjoy working with the framework.

Read full topic

item.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
item.dc:creator: @TheAJ TheAJ
item.description:
@TheAJ wrote:

[quote=“Chingchong123, post:266, topic:427696”]How are you supposed to let your friends get on this etc?
i have used mysql before but it wasnt eay…[/quote]

I don’t think there is any additional steps to get your friends online.
Possibly you would need to portforward if you have a router, and allow the port to endpoints outside your LAN via your firewall settings.

item.dc:creator: @Mr_Moose Mr Moose
item.description:
@Mr_Moose wrote:

johnl17:

I like how he used a similar statement about people who think java and C# are the same like me

Indeed, but Java and C# do have similar attributes. In fact, I like C# because of it’s similarities to Java, and I have to say, I do prefer it over Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
item.dc:creator: @johnl17 johnl17
item.description:
@johnl17 wrote:

[quote=“Mr Moose, post:254, topic:427696”][quote author=TheAJ link=topic=530391.msg3920539#msg3920539 date=1329668969]
Read my previous post properly.

Firstly, Jolt has been around longer than Ziotic. Jolt was first started on July 2009, and the Jolt v2 generation emulators starting in February 2011.

Secondly, Jolt has been using RuneScape’s 666 revision since it was released (back in September 2011), whilst the original Ziotic was made for 640. The 666 Ziotic you are talking about was released AFTER we released our Jolt v2 preview. Also to add to this, Jolt v2 preview was also released before Ziotic 640 was leaked. Explain how we are going to leach a server that we had no access to what-so-ever. If you’d like, go ask the Ziotic team (laz,maxi), they’ll even tell, Jolt is completely different from Ziotic.

Thirdly, Java and C# are NOT the same thing, and anything who says so are complete and utter retards. Sure, they share similar syntax, but where do you think Java got their syntax from? They got it from C/C++. I know C/C++, C#, and Java very well, and I can tell you each one of these languages are very different from each other, except for their similar syntax. They have similar syntax so it’s easier to migrate between languages without getting confused about their syntax and conventions.

I am going to assume that you don’t know either Java nor C# because of these retarded statements you are trying to persuade. I could go on for days about you’re arguments are invalid, but this is wasting my time.
[/quote]

I love you. Also it’s very unfortunate people in many communities like MSCP would rather use a crappy server written in java, than a stable, unique server written in C#.[/quote]
I like how he used a similar statement about people who think java and C# are the same like me

Read full topic

Secondly, Jolt has been using RuneScape’s 666 revision since it was released (back in September 2011), whilst the original Ziotic was made for 640. Explain how we are going to leach a server that we had no access to what-so-ever. If you’d like, go ask the Ziotic team (laz,maxi), they’ll even tell, Jolt is completely different from Ziotic.

Thirdly, Java and C# are NOT the same thing, and anything who says so are complete and utter retards. Sure, they share similar syntax, but where do you think Java got their syntax from? They got it from C/C++. I know C/C++, C#, and Java very well, and I can tell you each one of these languages are very different from each other, except for their similar syntax. They have similar syntax so it’s easier to migrate between languages without getting confused about their syntax and conventions.

I am going to assume that you don’t know either Java nor C# because of these retarded statements you are trying to persuade. I could go on for days about you’re arguments are invalid, but this is wasting my time.[/quote]

I love you. Also it’s very unfortunate people in many communities like MSCP would rather use a crappy server written in java, than a stable, unique server written in C#.

item.title: Jolt Environment v2 [666 - C# - MySQL]
item.dc:creator: @TheAJ TheAJ
item.description:
@TheAJ wrote:

shabba 56:

alright insted of talking shit show what is different from ziotic and this server pretty sure its easy to change a few java codes into c# show photos proving that its not leeched ziotic is loading 666 its still 639 revesion if you can read

Read my previous post properly.

Firstly, Jolt has been around longer than Ziotic. Jolt was first started on July 2009, and the Jolt v2 generation emulators starting in February 2011.

Secondly, Jolt has been using RuneScape’s 666 revision since it was released (back in September 2011), whilst the original Ziotic was made for 640. The 666 Ziotic you are talking about was released AFTER we released our Jolt v2 preview. Also to add to this, Jolt v2 preview was also released before Ziotic 640 was leaked. Explain how we are going to leach a server that we had no access to what-so-ever. If you’d like, go ask the Ziotic team (laz,maxi), they’ll even tell, Jolt is completely different from Ziotic.

Thirdly, Java and C# are NOT the same thing, and anything who says so are complete and utter retards. Sure, they share similar syntax, but where do you think Java got their syntax from? They got it from C/C++. I know C/C++, C#, and Java very well, and I can tell you each one of these languages are very different from each other, except for their similar syntax. They have similar syntax so it’s easier to migrate between languages without getting confused about their syntax and conventions.

I am going to assume that you don’t know either Java nor C# because of these retarded statements you are trying to persuade. I could go on for days about you’re arguments are invalid, but this is wasting my time.

Read full topic
